{"step_by_step_thinking": "Red blood cells (RBCs) are stored in blood banks for transfusion purposes. The storage temperature is crucial to maintain the viability and functionality of the RBCs. Storing at too low or too high temperatures can damage the cells. The standard storage temperature for RBCs is 1-6 degC. Therefore, the closest option is 2-6 degC.", "answer_choice": "B"}
